channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 4th July
item.description:
These 3 vehicles have been parked here for 9 months and haven't moved at all

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marsh Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of asbestos found on allotment plot 15B, 4th July
item.description:
A large amount of asbestos has ben found on Grasmere Allotment Plot 15B after inspection. This is a potentially dangerous health and safety issue as the tenants of adjoining plots often have very young children with them. The Plot has been unattended for several years and it is believed that the asbestos originated from the previous owner, deceased for several years, of the property at Grasmere Road adjoining the plot who also was tenant of Plots 15A and 15B on the allotment for 40 or more years. This has been reported to the Council and to the Allotment Help Desk and Grounds Maintenance several times with no action being taken, no response other than acknowledgement from the Help Desk and NO HELP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Grasmere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Lime Bike, 4th July
item.description:
A male resident of Raven Close, Romford, Essex, RM7 0FD has illegally used and dumped a Lime bike within our estate. Please arrange for the immediate collection of the bike, which is located at the end of Raven Close, in front of the children's play area, leaning behind a bin shed wall to the left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raven Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction on the public highway, 3rd July

item.title: High Street SE20 (Penge) to the left of house n, 3rd July
item.description:

item.title: Trip hazard to members of public. Paving stone loose and wobbly with concrete post about to fall over at some point. item.title: Broken glass on road outside 22-26 Westcombe Park Road, 3rd July
item.description:

item.title: Pavement, 92 Glengall Road., 3rd July
item.description:

item.title: Croxted Road SE24 a few yards south of Hawarden, 3rd July
item.description:
Croxted Road SE24 a few yards south of Hawarden Grove junction / at the side of house number 1 Hawarden Grove gutter grate 100% blocked on Croxted Road. Grate is on double yellow lines so access should be okay. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor picture and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4485246,-0.0984746,3a,18.4y,273.52h,80.2t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sPwz8FZdsXkn0BnWkv5HqsQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D9.80395897467045%26panoid%3DPwz8FZdsXkn0BnWkv5HqsQ%26yaw%3D273.52040593275!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDYzMC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hawarden Grove, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
